title: Key Account Manager
content:
Astrodyne TDI is adding a Key Account Manager (KAM) in the Pacific Northwest. This position will focus on creating new technical engagements and developing business within the AeroMil market with special emphasis supporting Boeing, Lockheed, BAE and General Dynamics. A deep understanding of the Defense and Aviation market along with existing commercial and technical relationships is a requirement for the position. Specifically, the initial target account will be Boeing, but the scope of responsibility has the potential to expand over time. The KAM will focus exclusively on developing a strategic sales plan to grow sales of all ATDI product lines at the target account. Initially, the KAM will be trained to sell the full suite of ATDI standard power supplies and filters. However, the strategic objective is to engage the full technical capability of ATDI as the engineering extension of the target OEM. These higher technology integrated products include power distribution sub-systems with integrated filtering, auxiliary power, energy storage, and power conditioning. The KAM will also develop and nurture senior-level client relationships to expand the ATDI position across all relevant business units within Boeing. This position will have complete account management that includes revenue budgeting, forecasting, technical support management, and quarterly business reviews. Ideally, the KAM will be located within driving distance of the target OEM engineering centers and work out of a home office. Travel is estimated at 25% outside of the territory but is dependent on the needs of the customer. This KAM is the “face” of Astrodyne TDI to the customer. The KAM has the authority to negotiate on behalf of the Company and represents the company fully to the customer.
What You Will Do:

Develops a business plan for the penetration of the target account and rapid sales growth of the company’s full product lineup.
Implement defined strategies and tactics with timelines to achieve short-term and long-term projected sales goals
Establishes and builds professional multi-level relationships with critical stakeholders at the key account
Prepares, recommends and negotiates pricing, terms and conditions for quotations (RFQ's) blanket agreements, and contracts for management approval.
In conjunction with Marketing and Engineering teams, creates effective proposals and RFP/RFQ responses that identify prospects’ needs and requirements and outline our solution and value proposition.
Proactively manages and maintains a high level of customer satisfaction
Drives on-going, proactive qualification, management and progression of sales leads and prospects.
Lead the resolution of customer concerns, complaints and corrective actions.
Provides local training and technical applications support to representatives and customer base.
Attends trade shows and other market/industry events and possibly acquires speaking engagements.
Continually develop and improve product and industry knowledge to maintain professionalism and stay abreast of new developments through contacts with professional organizations, publications, trade shows and customers to leverage them for the sustainability of the company.
Anticipate market trends, competitive activities and customer strategies to identify risks and develop opportunities. Develop strategies to capture opportunities and mitigate risks in Key Accounts.
Maintains the SalesForce.com database of opportunities and contacts

What You Bring To The Role:

A minimum of 5 to 10 years of experience in the Pacific Northwest territory with an established network of contacts within Aerospace / Defense is a requirement.
A minimum of a Bachelor’s Degree iin Business is required; an Engineering degree is strongly preferred.
Possesses the ability to influence and drive other internal organizations, that are not direct reports, to achieve solutions for customers and meet deadlines.
Demonstrates a consultative approach and ability to make recommendations to Company prospects with solutions that can meet their requirements.
Must have capability to refine existing information and further develop and qualify leads/opportunities through referrals, networks, trade shows, web resources, and other methods to enhance the opportunity pipeline.
To be successful, the KAM must be a Coach and Leader capable of demonstrating effective Leadership and Sales skills and abilities and must possess and utilize highly advanced communications skills with tact and diplomacy.
An aggressive, take-charge personality combined with professionalism and sales “know-how” will define the successful KAM.

How You Stand Out:

Power Supply industry or EMI Filter sales experience is preferred, but not a requirement.
A working understanding of the defense and aviation equipment market and technologies is strongly preferred.

AAP/EEO Statement
Astrodyne TDI is an Equal Opportunity / Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion or creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, citizenship status, marital status, disability, military status, genetic information, or any other legally protected status.
NOTICE TO THIRD PARTY AGENCIES:
Please note that Astrodyne TDI does not accept unsolicited resumes from recruiters or employment agencies. In the absence of a signed Recruitment Fee Agreement, Astrodyne TDI will not consider or agree to payment of any referral compensation or recruiter fee. In the event a recruiter or agency submits a resume or candidate without a previously signed agreement, Astrodyne TDI explicitly reserves the right to pursue and hire those candidate(s) without any financial obligation to the recruiter or agency. Any unsolicited resumes, including those submitted to hiring managers, are deemed to be the property of Astrodyne TDI.
